snippet: Arresting an Atlanta-area man suspected of printing $1 million in fake money required months of detective work and another man’s ill-fated decision not to bail someone out.
abstract: Federal agents arrest Heath J Kellogg, Atlanta-area man suspected of printing $1.1 million in fake $50 bills, after months of detective work and use of confidential informer; Kellogg, who apparently manipulated scanners and printers to create money, appears to be part of one of larger counterfeit rings in the South.
lead_paragraph: Arresting an Atlanta-area man suspected of printing $1 million in fake money required months of detective work and another man’s ill-fated decision not to bail someone out.

headline.seo: Details of Counterfeiting Ring Unfold in Atlanta Case
headline.main: On the Trail of a Counterfeiter Called ‘The Printer’
headline.print_headline: On the Trail of a Counterfeiter Called ‘The Printer’
